com.topcoder.ecommerce.creditcard.validation.algorithms
Class ValidationRange

java.lang.Object
  com.topcoder.ecommerce.creditcard.validation.algorithms.AbstractValidationAlgorithm
      com.topcoder.ecommerce.creditcard.validation.algorithms.ValidationRange
All Implemented Interfaces:
ValidationAlgorithm
Direct Known Subclasses:
ValidationPrefix
public class ValidationRange
extends AbstractValidationAlgorithm

Purpose: an implementation of a ValidationAlgorithm that validates that the digits at a specific position are within a specified range.

This class is thread safe because all attributes are immutable

Version:
1.0
Author:
Pops, TCSDEVELOPER

Constructor Detail

ValidationRange

public ValidationRange(java.lang.String startPrefix,
                       java.lang.String endPrefix,
                       int position)

Purpose: creates an instance of the ValidationRange class that will validate a range of numbers at a specific position within the credit card number text. 

Typical Args:

  1. A non-null, non-empty string
  2. A non-null, non-empty string
  3. An integer >= 1

Parameters:
startPrefix - A non-null, non-empty string
endPrefix - A non-null, non-empty string
position - The Position (1 based) in the text to check
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the position < 1 or if start or end prefix is an empty string or if start prefix is greater than end prefix when compared or if the start and ending prefix are different lengths
java.lang.NullPointerException - if start or end prefix is null
Method Detail

isValid

public boolean isValid(java.lang.String creditCardText)

Purpose: validates the passed text by checking to see if the specified position/length is with (inclusive) the range.  Please see ValidationAlgorithm#isValid(String) for more details

Typical Args: a text string - possibly null, possibly empty - validation is done by the validators.

Typical Return value: true if the parse number is between (inclusive) the startPrefix and endPrefix at position

Parameters:
creditCardText - true if the parse number is between (inclusive) the startPrefix and endPrefix at position
Returns:
true if the parse number is between (inclusive) the StartNumber and EndNumber at Position

Purpose: This method will get return the position variable

Typical Return value: a >= 1 integer

a >= 1 integer
